channel.title: trips on Jorge Cortell blog
channel.description: Recent content in trips on Jorge Cortell blog

item.title: Three days in Zurich
item.description: My wife and I were invited by UBS Industry Leaders Network to a very interesting event at the IBM Research Center in Zurich.

item.title: A week in Bangkok
item.description: For a week I was in Bangkok working, presenting at a conference, but also enjoying art, food and shopping.

item.title: Two weeks in Ontario, Canada
item.description: For a little bit over two weeks I’ve been in Ontario, Canada (between Buffalo and Niagara) visiting my in-laws and cat sitting.

item.title: Four days in Bogota
item.description: A successful and tiresome business trip to Colombia.

item.title: A day in Dallas
item.description: Today I took four flights to go have lunch with one of my earliest customers, whom I consider friends.

item.title: Two days in Boston
item.description: Thursday and Friday I was in Boston, for a business meeting, some art, and to give a talk at MIT.

item.title: Two months in Vancouver
item.description: For the past two months we’ve been living in Vancouver, helping my son find an apartment and getting settled, as he’s going to be pursuing his college studies in the city.

item.title: Two days in Brussels
item.description: On Tuesday I flew from Vancouver to Brussels to attend a pre-departure meeting ahead of my EU Trade Mission to Japan. Most importantly I had a chance to visit my dear Bozar Cetre for Fine Arst.

item.title: MoA Vancouver
item.description: We decided to start the new year by going to the Museum of Anthropology (MoA) at the University of British Columbia (UBC), in Vancouver (Canada).

item.title: MoCa Shanghai and People's park
item.description: Monday December 16th, before flying back to Vancouver from Shanghai, I visited MoCa Shanghai and People’s Park.

item.title: Invited to present at the WoWo-Fosun Protechting Innovation event in Shanghai
item.description: December 15th I traveled from Vancouver to Shanghai to present at the WoWo-Fosun Protechting Innovation event.

item.title: In London for investor meetings at UBS and KPMG
item.description: December 4th and 5th I traveled from Helsinki to London for two investor related meetings, at KPMG and UBS.

item.title: In Helsinki to receive the Innovation Leader award, HIMSS Future50
item.description: Tuesday December 3rd I traveled from Vancouver to Helsinki to receive the highest honor in our industry (Healthcare Technology): Innovation Leader of the HIMSS Future50.

item.title: In Shanghai and networking at the Suzhou Science & Technology Town
item.description: Thursday November 28th we flew to Shanghai to visit the SSTT.

item.title: Presenting at the Innovation Institute networking conference One Future China in XiAn
item.description: Wednesday November 27th we flew to Xi’an for the Cybernaut & Zhejiang University Innovation Institute networking conference One Future China.

item.title: Invited to exhibit at the Wenzhou Private Enterprise Talents Week
item.description: My new partners in China, Cybernaut, invited me tour several cities with them, to expand our business. The first stop was Wenzhou.

item.title: Speaker at the Romanian Regional Institute of Oncology Congress in Iasi
item.description: It’s not common that a non-oncologist gets to be invited as speaker at an Oncology congress. But November 21-24 I was invited to speak at Confer.

item.title: At the Contemporary Art Center in Malaga
item.description: November 13th, after a work meeting, I visited the Malaga CAC.

item.title: Invited to speak at the UBS Health Tech investors event in Dubai
item.description: November 5th I was invited to speak at a couple of UBS Health Tech investors events in Dubai.

item.title: Invited to the UBS Industry Leaders Network meeting in Hong Kong
item.description: October 30th and 31st I was invited to the UBS Industry Leaders Network meeting in Hong Kong titled “Emerging Technologies in China”.

item.title: Invited to the UBS Disruptive Technology CEO Summit in Hong Kong
item.description: October 29th I was invited to the UBS Disruptive Technology CEO Summit in Hong Kong.

item.title: At Tai Kwun Centre in Hong Kong
item.description: A week and a half later, I’m back in Hong Kong. And this time I did see a lot of really good art.

item.title: A day in Hong Kong
item.description: October 19 I spent the day in Hong Kong, staying at the Mira Hotel (where one of my heroes, Edward Snowden, stayed in room 1014 and handed over the largest government classified info leak to journalists).

item.title: Two days in Shenzhen
item.description: October 17 and 18 I went to Shenzhen for more lectures, company visits, and pitch events.

item.title: One day in Hanghzou
item.description: October 16 I went to Hanghzou to meet executives from Alibaba and investors from the Zhejiang CKGSB Alumni Association.

item.title: One day in Shanghai
item.description: October 15 I went to Shanghai for more lectures, and to meet the biggest investment fund in China: Fosun.

item.title: Two days in Beijing
item.description: October 13 and 14 I was in Beijing for a Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business CKGSB program called China Start: a one-week China immersion program for global start-ups and growth companies to learn China-specific knowledge, network with potential local partners and pitch for Chinese investment. The program is managed by Bo Ji (Chief Representative, GKGSB Europe; Assistant Dean, Global Executive Education) and his amazing team.

item.title: Another week in Bangkok
item.description: September 23-27 I was in Bangkok, invited by the European Union to present at BioInvestment Asia.

item.title: Presenting at a NASA awards event in Orlando
item.description: September 7-11 I was invited to present at a NASA awards ceremony in Orlando, Florida (USA).

item.title: Two weeks in Bangkok with Alvaro and Thomas
item.description: August 11-24 I was in Bangkok with my friends Alvaro and Thomas.

item.title: Back in Valencia, in time for the heatwave
item.description: Back in Valencia for a few days… in time to experience the heatwave (45º C - 114º F).

item.title: Last day in New York, Coney Island
item.description: Friday was our last day in New York. To end an amazing trip on a high note, we took my daughter to… Coney Island!

item.title: The Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum
item.description: On Thursday my son and I walked to the Intrepid from our apartment.

item.title: NYU Game Center
item.description: On Wednesday we attended the New York University Student Show.

item.title: At the Statue of Liberty
item.description: Thursday August 1st we took the ferry to go to the Statue of Liberty.

item.title: Guggenheim Museum and searching for sneakers
item.description: We spent Tuesday at the Guggenheim museum and looking for a special pair of sneakers.

item.title: Taking the Staten Island Ferry
item.description: On Monday my daughter and I took the Staten Island Ferry for some awesome pictures of Manhattan from the river.

item.title: Attending Slime Expo NY
item.description: On Sunday I took my daughter to the Slime Expo NYC, in Brooklyn.

item.title: Picnic with friends at the Hudson Valley
item.description: On Saturday we met our friends Karen and Carmine, with their dog Bear, and had a picnic in the Hudson Valley.

item.title: Hayden Planetarium and Picnic in Central Park
item.description: On Friday we went to the Hayden Planetarium at the American Museum of Natural History, and then had a picnic in Central Park.

item.title: Paperwork and Canal Street Market
item.description: On Wednesday we spent the whole morning doing paperwork errands, and then went to Canal Street Market.

item.title: Nasty weather
item.description: Spending July in Manhattan you can expect heat and humidity, but in a week we’ve had a blackout, a heatwave, and flash flooding!

item.title: Bronx Zoo
item.description: Last Saturday we spent the day at the Bronx Zoo, and then had dinner with friends in Manhattan.

item.title: Nintendo Store in Rockefeller Center
item.description: Last Friday we went to the Nintendo Store at Rockefeller Center, New York.

item.title: Pizza, Ice cream, and Chocolate in New York
item.description: Let’s talk about some unique foods in NY.

item.title: One World Observatory
item.description: Monday July 15th we went all the way up to the 102nd floor of the One World Observatory.

item.title: Chinatown
item.description: Friday July 12th we went for a walk around Chinatown.

item.title: Shopping in Soho and walking in Central Park
item.description: We spent Wednesday walking around Central Park and Soho.

item.title: Moving into our apartment in Times Square on the 4th of July
item.description: As my teenage son starts his university studies at New York University, we decided to accompany him, so for a month we have moved into an apartment on the 42nd floor in Times Square.

item.title: On board Ponant's Le Bougainville
item.description: Yesterday we went on board a small luxury cruise ship docked in Valencia for the day: Ponant’s Le Bougainville.

item.title: A day in Madrid
item.description: Last Thursday I went to Madrid with my son in the high speed train, for a couple of quick meetings.

item.title: At the most luxurious cruise ship in the world - Regent Explorer
item.description: On Monday we were onboard the most luxurious cruise ship in the world (Regent’s Seven Seas Explorer).

item.title: A day at the Guggenheim in Bilbao
item.description: We spent Sunday at the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao (Spain).

item.title: A day in Zaragoza and San Sebastian
item.description: On Saturday we drove to Zaragoza and San Sebastian (Spain).

item.title: A day in Albir
item.description: Last Wednesday I drove to L’Albir in Alicante (Spain) with my dad for a nice lunch on the beach and a business meeting.

item.title: A weekend of museums in Amsterdam
item.description: We spent last weekend visiting museums in Amsterdam.

item.title: TNW Amsterdam
item.description: May 9th and 10th I was invited to attend and exhibit at the largest tech event in Europe: TNW (Amsterdam).

item.title: Three days in Sydney
item.description: April 7th to 10th, we were in Sydney visiting a friend and working.

item.title: MONA
item.description: April 5th, we spent the day at the espectacular MONA (Museum of Old and New Art) in Tasmania (Australia).

item.title: Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary
item.description: April 4th, we spent the day at the Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary in Tasmania (Australia), feeding and petting many awesome creatures!

item.title: Sailing through a storm in the Tasman sea
item.description: April 1st to 3rd, we sailed through a storm in the Tasman Sea (between New Zealand and Australia).

item.title: Taieri Gorge Train
item.description: March 31st we took a train in Dunedin to Pukerangi, so we could see the Taleri Gorge (New Zealand).

item.title: Wildlife cruise in the Otago Peninsula
item.description: March 30th we arrived in Dunedin (New Zealand) for a wildlife cruise in the Otago Peninsula.

item.title: A day in Akaroa
item.description: March 29th we arrived in Akaroa (New Zealand) with a double mission: to see Alpacas and Blue Penguins.

item.title: A day in Picton
item.description: March 28th we arrived in Picton (New Zealand) to tour some Marlborough wineries.

item.title: A day in Napier
item.description: March 27th, after a day of sailing, we docked in Napier (New Zealand).

item.title: A day in Tauranga and Rotorua
item.description: March 25th, after a day of sailing, we docked in Tauranga and spent the day in Rotorua (New Zealand).

item.title: A day in Auckland
item.description: March 22nd we spent the day in Auckland, New Zealand, after 37 hours of traveling (25 flying).

item.title: A day in Amsterdam
item.description: March 3rd I was supposed to be home in Spain, and yet, here I was, in Amsterdam by accident.

item.title: Four days in Bangkok... again
item.description: You know when a customer calls you on a Sunday night on your cell and tells you “I want to meet you tomorrow”? Yeah, it happens all the time. Except my customer was in Bangkok (Thailand) and I was in Valencia (Spain). Of course, I said “yes”. Here’s another one: you know when you’re supposed to take an 11 hour flight back home, but Pakistan and India escalate military frictions, close air space, and your flight gets rerouted for an extra 3 hours, making you miss your connexion and forcing you to stay in another country for an extra day? Yeah, it doesn’t happen that often. Now try both at the same time. Welcome to my world.

item.title: A weekend in the Best Spa in Europe
item.description: I don’t know that anyone does any more, nor do I care, but if you read my blog, you probably think “all that traveling almost back to back must be exhausting”. And you would be right. That’s why my wonderful wife invited us to a spa weekend in the Best Spa in Europe: SHA Wellness.

item.title: A day in Malaga
item.description: February 19 I spent the day in Malaga (Spain) for a reference site visit with my Director for the Brazilian market.

item.title: A day in Frankfurt
item.description: February 15 I spent the day in Frankfurt (Germany) to attend a business meeting.

item.title: Four days in Orlando
item.description: February 10-14 I spent 4 days in Orlando, FL (USA) to attend the HIMSS trade show.

item.title: Four days in Bangkok
item.description: February 5-8 I went to Bangkok (Thailand) for some important and last minute business meetings.

item.title: Two days in Bucharest
item.description: January 28-30th I spent a couple of days in Bucharest (Romania).

item.title: Two days in Southampton
item.description: January 8-10th I spent a couple of days in Southampton.

item.title: Ice skating, bikes, and cars
item.description: Today we went ice skating, and rode ice bikes and ice bumper cars, at Buffalo’s Canalside. Cool!

item.title: Snowboarding in New York
item.description: Last year we went snowboarding in Canada. This year we went in New York.

item.title: Buffalo Zoo
item.description: We started the year with a controversial visit: the Buffalo Zoo.

item.title: Two days in Valencia
item.description: December 20th to 22nd I went to Valencia, to visit family and for a couple of business meetings.

item.title: Three days in London
item.description: December 17th to 19th I went to London, along with the President & CCO of my company, for some meetings with Private Equity and Private Banking firms.

item.title: Two days in Vancouver
item.description: December 9th to 11th I went to Vancouver with my family for some personal matters.

item.title: Five days in Chicago
item.description: Between November 25th and 29th I went to Chicago to attend, one more year, the RSNA trade show.

item.title: Two days in Lima
item.description: November 22nd and 23rd I went to Lima, Peru, to speak at a Telefonica event about healthcare.

item.title: Two days in Asuncion de Paraguay
item.description: November 20th and 21st I went to Asuncion de Paraguay, to speak at the II Healthcare IT Congress and to meet Paraguay’s Minister (Secretary) of Health.

item.title: A day in São Paulo
item.description: November 19 I went to São Paulo, for a few business meetings.

item.title: Two days in Oslo
item.description: November 12 and 13 I went to Oslo, invited as speaker at EHiN.

item.title: Two days in Frankfurt
item.description: November 5 and 6 I went to Frankfurt for a business meeting and lots of art.

item.title: Things I learned at Harvard Medical School Executive Education
item.description: October 25 and 26 I attended a Harvard Medical School Executive Education program titled “Trends in Health Technology” invited by UBS bank. Here are some of my notes from the lectures.

item.title: Three days in Boston
item.description: October 24 to 26 I was in Boston invited to a UBS bank event titled: “Trends in Health Technology”, as member of their Network of Industry Leaders - at Harvard Medical School, organized by the Executive Education Department of the university.

item.title: A day in Chicago
item.description: October 22 I went to Chicago for an interview for ICEX.tv.

item.title: A day in New York
item.description: Wednesday October 3rd I was in New York for a couple of very interesting business meetings.

item.title: A week in Mexico
item.description: September 24-28 I was in Mexico DF.

item.title: Canada house on Lake Erie
item.description: September 15th, as some of you already know, we moved for a few months to a house on Lake Erie (Canada).

item.title: Med cruise day 7
item.description: September 8th was our 7th day in our family Mediterranean cruise onboard the Norwegian Epic, spending the day in Palma. The following day we disembarked in Barcelona.

item.title: Med cruise day 6
item.description: September 7th was our 6th Mediterranean family cruise day onboard the Norwegian Epic, spending the day in Cannes.

item.title: Med cruise days 4 and 5
item.description: September 5th and 6th were our 4th and 5th days in our family Mediterranean cruise onboard the Norwegian Epic, spending one day in Rome (Civitavecchia), and the next one in Pisa (Livorno).

item.title: Med cruise days 2 and 3
item.description: September 3rd and 4th were our 2nd and 3rd days in our family Mediterranean cruise onboard the Norwegian Epic, spending one day at sea, and the next one in Naples.

item.title: Med cruise day 1
item.description: Our September 2nd to 9th family Mediterranean cruise onboard the Norwegian Epic started in Barcelona.

item.title: Summer in Valencia
item.description: I do not know if it’s living in London, traveling a lot, or what, but over the years I have started appreciating my hometown more.

item.title: A week in Cambridge
item.description: For a mix of work and vacation time with the kids, we spent a week in Cambridge (UK).

item.title: Two days in Malaga
item.description: Monday and Tuesday I went to Malaga (Spain) with my wife, to meet some customers.

item.title: Two days in Milan
item.description: In order to attend the European Society for Human Genetics conference, I spent a weekend in Milan (Italy) with my wife.

item.title: Two days in Brussels
item.description: I was invited to spend two days in Brussels for two purposes: to study the possibility of investing there, and also to present the report I co-authored for the EU Commission Expert Group on Venture Philanthropy & Social Investment.

item.title: Two days in Barcelona
item.description: We spent last weekend in Barcelona.

item.title: Easter in Ireland
item.description: We spent the first four days of April in Ireland, the only country in Western Europe I had not visited yet, enjoying an activity-packed Easter break with my girls.

item.title: A week in Ibiza
item.description: March 25 to 29 we “had to” accompany some friends visiting Ibiza (Spanish Balearic Island) from New York.

item.title: Two days in Malaga
item.description: After an unexpected delay, I spent a couple days in Malaga.

item.title: Fallas with friends
item.description: As most Valencians will tell you, you have to flee Fallas… unless you are “fallero/a” (participating member) or you have visitors in town. Then you brace yourself, and try to enjoy the madness one more year.

item.title: A week in Las Vegas
item.description: I spent a week in Las Vegas participating in the HIMSS trade show, both as exhibitor and as member of a Google Partner Panel.

item.title: On a mission in Reykjavik
item.description: After my meeting in Brussels, before flying back home, there was something I had to do in Iceland. I was on a mission.

item.title: A couple days in Brussels
item.description: In order to attend a meeting of the Expert Group on Venture Philanthropy and Social Investment of which I’m a member, I had to spend a couple of days in Brussels.

item.title: A day in London
item.description: On Wednesday I had breakfast in Fort Erie, lunch in Toronto, dinner on a plane, breakfast in Reykjiavik, lunch in London, and dinner in Brussels.

item.title: A couple of days in Houston... again
item.description: Sunday and Monday I went to Houston, Texas, for a couple of very important meetings.

item.title: RIT and Toronto Zoo
item.description: On January 28 we went to the Toronto Zoo to say good bye to the pandas. And February 9 we visited RIT.

item.title: A couple of days in Houston
item.description: I’m returning home from a business trip to Houston, after getting stranded, for the second time in a week, due to an ice storm.

item.title: Lisbon, London and Brussels
item.description: January 8-12 I travelled to Lisbon, London and Brussels.

item.title: Falls and Butterflies
item.description: December 28th we wento to see the almost frozen Niagara Falls, and the Butterfly Conservatory.

item.title: A day in Toronto
item.description: On Sunday we were in Toronto.

item.title: 5 days in Chicago
item.description: This week, from Sunday to Thursday, I have been in Chicago for a business trip, presenting at RSNA with Google.

item.title: A week in Mexico
item.description: This week, from Monday to Friday, I have been in Mexico for a business trip.

item.title: Niagara, Toronto, and critters
item.description: Living near the Niagara Falls is amazingly beautiful… so far.

item.title: European Commission Expert Group meeting
item.description: Last Monday, June 19, I participated in the first meeting of the European Commission Expert Group on Venture Philanthropy and Social Investments.
